page.title: 12THE VILLAGE HALL
page.content: THE VILLAGE HALL IN RODINGTON IS A NEW ONE, BUILT 10 YEARS AGO. IT IS A BRICK BUILT BUILDING WITH A FLAT ROOF. IT REPLACES THE TIN BUILDING WHICH USED TO SERVE AS THE VILLAGE HALL. THERE IS A LARGE CAR PARK. PLAYING FIELDS, WITH AN AREA OF SWINGS AND SLIDES FOR THE CHILDREN, SURROUND IT. THE CHILDREN ARE HOPING TO HAVE A B.M.X. TRACK CONSTRUCTED AT THE FAR END OF THESE PLAYING FIELDS. INSIDE THE VILLAGE HALL THERE IS A LARGE HALL WITH A WOODEN FLOOR SUITABLE FOR DANCING. (THE LOCAL VILLAGE SCHOOL USES THIS HALL FOR THEIR P.E. LESSONS). THERE IS A STAGE WITH CLOAKROOMS (INCLUDING SHOWERS) AND CHANGING ROOMS BEHIND THIS STAGE. THERE IS A KITCHEN AND ALSO A BAR WITH STORAGE SPACE FOR TABLES AND CRATES.
